author: rocky.j.mountain
title: `World-leading´ cyber security centre to open in London´s Olympic Park
summary: A new £13.5 million cyber security innovation centre is to be developed in the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park in London. The London Cyber Innovation Centre will help businesses identify cyber threats and help develop start-ups to solve the issues raised. Funding will be provided by the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) as part of the Government's £1.9 billion investment in keeping the UK safe online. The centre will also be used to help entrepreneurs secure commercial contracts and crucial investment in the cyber security industry. Minister for digital and creative industries Margot James said: “London is the undisputed leader of European tech, with billions of investment

author: nanook
title: New Malware Holds Your PC Hostage Until You Play 'PUBG'
summary: The PC world has a long and sordid history of malware — malicious software like spyware, viruses and adware — but the latest discovery from MalwareHunterTeam is nothing short of amusing. It encrypts a user's files until they launch PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, an insanely popular battle royale game more commonly known as PUBG. BleepingComputer reports that the “PUBG RansomWare” will invade your PC, encrypting your desktop files as well as document, music and photos folders, also appending them with a “.PUBG” extension. Once it has completed this process, it will splash a screen presenting you with two ways to overcome this hassle: Play PUBG for an hour, or simply enter a restore code, which is actually displayed right in the message.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Aviation Industry May Be Vulnerable To Cyberattack Through Its Global Supply Chain
summary: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link. As cybercriminals turn their attention to disruption of infrastructure industries, the aviation supply chain needs to upgrade and better coordinate its cybersecurity.

author: captainunderoos
title: Amber Rudd will launch a 'blitz' on cyber criminals
summary: Amber Rudd will today launch a blitz on cyber criminals who try to hide their 'horrifying' illegal activity on the so-called 'dark web'. The Home Secretary will announce a multi-million-pound crackdown on offenders who exploit the internet underworld to trade in drugs, guns and child abuse images or plot terror attacks. The anonymity of the 'dark web', which mirrors the normal internet but allows users to hide their identity, has attracted criminals seeking to avoid detection by the law enforcement agencies. The online currency Bitcoin provides a means of payment which makes transactions untraceable - meaning it is difficult for law enforcement agencies to track them down. Speaking at the Cyber

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Accend Networks Achieves Cisco Advanced Security Architecture Specialization
summary: Accend Networks ups its Cisco partnership to better serve its customers. If you're keeping up with the latest in network security news, you've probably heard of the recent remote attacks on Cisco devices, specifically in their IOS and IOS XE software such as the one mentioned here: https://www.securityweek.com/critical-flaw-exposes-many-cisco-devices-remote-attacks. If you happen to use the said device running on IOS with a Smart Install feature, chances are you were exposed to network threats and risked your IPS Security leading to a quick and reliable fix in your defence shield. Accend Networks, a California-based managed solutions firm, is offering quality services to prevent and mitigate risks surrounding computers and IT.

author: captainunderoos
title: Trump's homeland security adviser Bossert resigns on Bolton's request
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's homeland security adviser, Tom Bossert, has resigned at the request of new national security adviser John Bolton, an administration official said on Tuesday, marking the latest departure from the White House of a senior adviser. Bossert, a former deputy national security adviser to President George W. Bush, had overseen the administration's response to the Hurricane Maria disaster in Puerto Rico, as well as cybersecurity policy.
